about.summary: Performs support vectors analysis for data sets with survival outcome. Three approaches are available in the package: The regression approach takes censoring into account when formulating the inequality constraints of the support vector problem. In the ranking approach, the inequality constraints set the objective to maximize the concordance index for comparable pairs of observations. The hybrid approach combines the regression and ranking constraints in the same model.

name: r-survivalsvm
raw_meta_yaml:
{% set version = '0.0.5' %}
{% set posix = 'm2-' if win else '' %}
{% set native = 'm2w64-' if win else '' %}

package:
  name: r-survivalsvm
  version: {{ version|replace("-", "_") }}

source:
  url:
    - {{ cran_mirror }}/src/contrib/survivalsvm_{{ version }}.tar.gz
    - {{ cran_mirror }}/src/contrib/Archive/survivalsvm/survivalsvm_{{ version }}.tar.gz
  sha256: ea4d39ebecb38e4e4e89891b2d5c2ba222344879bcdd8dac9be0078c73cb90ac

build:
  merge_build_host: True  # [win]
  number: 1
  noarch: generic
  rpaths:
    - lib/R/lib/
    - lib/

requirements:
  build:
    - {{ posix }}zip               # [win]
  host:
    - r-base
    - r-hmisc
    - r-matrix
    - r-kernlab
    - r-pracma
    - r-quadprog
    - r-survival
  run:
    - r-base
    - r-hmisc
    - r-matrix
    - r-kernlab
    - r-pracma
    - r-quadprog
    - r-survival

test:
  commands:
    - $R -e "library('survivalsvm')"           # [not win]
    - "\"%R%\" -e \"library('survivalsvm')\""  # [win]

about:
  home: https://github.com/imbs-hl/survivalsvm
  license: GPL-3.0-only
  summary: 'Performs support vectors analysis for data sets with survival outcome. Three approaches
    are available in the package: The regression approach takes censoring into account
    when formulating the inequality constraints of the support vector problem. In the
    ranking approach, the inequality constraints set the objective to maximize the concordance
    index for comparable pairs of observations. The hybrid approach combines the regression
    and ranking constraints in the same model.'
  license_family: GPL3
  license_file:
    - '{{ environ["PREFIX"] }}/lib/R/share/licenses/GPL-3'

extra:
  recipe-maintainers:
    - conda-forge/r

# Package: survivalsvm
# Type: Package
# Title: Survival Support Vector Analysis
# Version: 0.0.5
# Date: 2018-01-05
# Author: Cesaire J. K. Fouodo
# Maintainer: Cesaire Fouodo <fouodo@imbs.uni-luebeck.de>
# Description: Performs support vectors analysis for data sets with survival outcome. Three approaches are available in the package: The regression approach takes censoring into account when formulating the inequality constraints of the support vector problem. In the ranking approach, the inequality constraints set the objective to maximize the concordance index for comparable pairs of observations. The hybrid approach combines the regression and ranking constraints in the same model.
# Imports: pracma, quadprog, kernlab, Matrix, stats, Hmisc
# Suggests: testthat
# Depends: survival
# License: GPL
# RoxygenNote: 6.0.1
# URL: https://github.com/imbs-hl/survivalsvm
# BugReports: https://github.com/imbs-hl/survivalsvm/issues
# NeedsCompilation: no
# Packaged: 2018-02-05 06:44:20 UTC; fouodo
# Repository: CRAN
# Date/Publication: 2018-02-05 07:01:13 UTC
smithy_version:
No azure token. Create a token and
put it in ~/.conda-smithy/azure.token
3.7.1
